sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Thousands marched in the streets of Paris and other cities throughout France to protest against new government restrictions to prevent the spread of COVID-19.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The French government wants to require proof of vaccination for those entering restaurants, cafes and other public establishments.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Every Saturday for the past few weeks in Vienna, tens of thousands of people have taken to the streets to voice their discontent against the vaccine mandate starting in February for almost all residents over 14 years old.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: People demonstrated in Copenhagen against the COVID-19 vaccine and for the children's right to choose.

The protest was taking place for the third week in a row, with organisers saying that they will continue as long as current restrictions remain in place.

sentences.sentence: long-range bombers to patrol the skies over Belarus. A mission intended to underline close defense ties between the two allies amid tensions with the West.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Russian Defense Ministry said the two strategic strike bombers practiced performing joint tasks with the Belarusian Air Force and Air Defense.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The four patrol marked Russia's third such mission in Belarus since last month and took place amid Western concerns over Russian troop build-up near Ukraine's border.

sentences.sentence: Steeped in legend, the first ever Bloody Mary is believed to have been made on this counter a hundred years ago at Harry's bar in Paris.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Frenchman Fernand Piteau created the recipe that remains unchanged to the present.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It's a classic drink, make it directly on the glasses. So, a few pints of salt and pepper,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: then a few dash of Tabasco, a splash of Worcestershire sauce, same for lemon juice.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: To add to the mystique, there are many tales of how the drink got its memorable name.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The creator of the drink said it was christened after punters remarked that it reminded them of an American waitress named Mary.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: She used to work in a place in Chicago called the Bucket of Blood.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: So that's the story he gives.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: You can give a few more stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: There's a Hemingway story.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: He was just, I think it was just before getting married and he was dating somebody called Mary and he didn't want to smell alcohol in his breath so he asked for something with a thick juice, being tomato juice, and saying Bloody Mary while drinking it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: You also have the Queen Mary, the Bloody Mary in England.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The drink is so closely associated with Harry's Bar that people come from around the world to sip on one of 12,000 Bloody Marys served here every year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: One hundred years on, it remains a firm classic.
